ReviewList.Text: First I have to say that I love Elizabeth Nelson's books. she has a way of writing that keeps you hooked. Misty has gone and moved to start her life over after leaving her cheating husband. then she goes and gets in a car accident and the guy who rescues her Aaron is dropped dead gorgeous and a firefighter. while being in a new city and her wrecked car she has no choice but to call her sister Amanda to come and help her. Amanda has her own problems and stays with her sister. Then misty bumps into her rescuer in the supermarket. Sparks fly between Misty and Aaron and more stuff happens I'm not going to spoil the rest of the story please read and you will not be disappointed with this book.

I'm pretty sure the author has confused lust for love. Sex does NOT equal love. There was nothing believable about the relationship other than they had a lot of sex over the course of what, 5 or 6 days? There was no real connection between the H/h, and the fact that the hero exhibits controlling characteristics just like her ex-husband and she still falls into bed with him? The heroine was a fool, the hero wasn't anyone worth drooling over. I am glad this was free and I am HAPPY to be deleting it off of my Kindle.

Wrong title.  Main character (female) was far from "cautious".  Male character seemed quite 'stalker like' in early stages of book.  Too contrived.  If you want to write about sex just do it... if you want to write a novel, try to come up with an actual plot and believable characters...

This book is way too short and too packed within such a small space. It seems like the author wanted to put every plot she ever read in this one story. It was so full of stuff that it was hard to concentrate and enjoy the story.  Elizabeth next time give us more substance and less drama. It seems like you put what could take a total of at least a year of a relationship into one week. Not good!!!!!!!!!!

Who doesn't love a hot fire fighter!?! Cautious was a great, fun smokin hot read. I loved Aaron and his alpha male personality! I have a few Elizabeth Nelson books on my Kindle that will now be moving up on my TBR list. If your looking for a quick east hot read this book is perfect for you!

Story was OK. It lacked depth and proper development. I found the characters passable (they were nice persons but something was just off ) The plot just had a so many bit with he sad what? she did what? that made you go huh? Good thing it was free, waste of money if you had to pay for it.
Main character had been through a painful break up but was okay to jump right into controlling relationship.  Not what you want to see in a strong woman.

If you want a mindless read while laying on the beach, I guess you could do worse.  Maybe… If you want any depth in either characters or plot, you will not find it here. The main character is a bit of a slut and her sister is a bit of a backstabbing slut. The main characters literally have no interaction in the book but sex, despite the fact that she was in a car accident and he was burned and has a cracked rib.  Both of which are only mentioned when convenient to the plot, such as it is.  More soap opera than romance novel.  Not really worth reading…
Exciting storyline with interesting characters.  Light romance with a cute ending.  It is a great short and easy read and with the time!

This book was not the best I've ever read but it was a cute story.  It was not very believable and the book was too short to really develop the plot.  Unless the story was more developed, I would not read another book from this author.

It was an ok read. I was actually enjoying it until it got a little too unrealistic and ... the hospital sex? That almost made me stop reading. I usually give books the benefit of the doubt, which is what my 3 stars represent. He was moving far too fast and the I love yous' were completely uncalled for. There can intense romance without people falling in love in a week. Overall, I think it was ok, not great, but readable.

I enjoyed this slow pace romance novella. The Main characters were strong and confident at some point. Misty was struggling with her past to be able to welcome the present. The sex scene on the other hand, where nailed with a deliciously spicy taste to them. Loved the "forgiving" place Elizabeth Nelson was trying to take me to, or at least that's how I got it😃 hope you enjoy this book like I did!

It's so poorly written I couldn't finish this book. No wonder it was free. It's so unrealistic and cheesy. It moves way to fast, she just met this guy after getting out of an abusive relationship and the next night she's sleeping with him. I majored in social work and I can tell you there's a 99% chance that would never happen.  I only gave this book one star because I couldn't give it zero stars.
the book was well written but the story line is lacking any depth.  It was fast and totally predictable and even the sex was very fast and unemotional.
What a great book. A hot, rich fireman rescues a woman and makes her his own. Steamy lovemaking and just a bit of drama in this quick read. Loved it.

Sweet, and as delicious as death by chocolate!  I thoroughly enjoyed this short but oh so good romance.  I only hope that the author does her readers the favor of a much longer followup novel that will tie up all the loose ends from this story.

A short but sweet and definitely HOT story! Misty was scared and future issues could have deepened the lasting effect on her life but Aaron showed her love and loving that gave her the strength needed to overcome anything. Original story line, a little fairy tale but none the less a good read.

"Cautious" was a fast paced romantic short story.  Misty is coming out of a bad relationship and divorce. Aaron is a dominant, sexy, firefighter who saved Misty's life.  Misty and Aaron's story is filled with drama a steamy love scenes.  The story is very predictable and just OK in my book.  The editing could have been a little better.  If the plot of the story was a little more developed it might have made a good full fledged novel.
